title: Mind is Everything
content: All that we are is the result of what we have thought. The mind is everything. What we think we become.

title: The Teaching of All Buddhas
content: Avoid all evil, cultivate good, purify your mind - this is the teaching of all the Buddhas.

title: Mind as the Forerunner
content: All mental phenomena have mind as their forerunner; they have mind as their chief; they are mind-made. If one speaks or acts with a serene mind, happiness follows, as surely as one's shadow.

title: The Four Noble Truths
content: Life contains suffering (dukkha). Suffering arises from attachment and craving (tanha). Suffering can cease when attachment ceases (nirodha). The Eightfold Path leads to the cessation of suffering.

title: Loving-Kindness for All Beings
content: May all beings be happy and secure. May all beings be healthy and strong. May all beings live with ease. Just as a mother protects her only child, so should we cultivate boundless love for all living beings.

title: Mind as the Foundation
content: All that we are is the result of what we have thought: it is founded on our thoughts, it is made up of our thoughts. If a man speaks or acts with an evil thought, pain follows him, as the wheel follows the foot of the ox that draws the carriage.

title: Mind and Happiness
content: All that we are is the result of what we have thought: it is founded on our thoughts, it is made up of our thoughts. If a man speaks or acts with a pure thought, happiness follows him, like a shadow that never leaves him.

title: The Essence of Buddha's Teaching
content: Not to commit any sin, to do good, and to purify one's mind, that is the teaching of all the Buddhas.

title: True Meditation
content: There is no meditation for those who lack wisdom, no wisdom for those who do not meditate. The one who both meditates and has wisdom is close to nirvana.

title: Path to Happiness
content: Let us live happily then, not hating those who hate us! Among men who hate us let us dwell free from hatred!

title: Self-Reliance in Liberation
content: You yourself must strive. The Buddhas only point the way. Those who meditate and enter the path are freed from the bondage of Mara.

title: Victory Over Self
content: Better than a thousand hollow words is one word that brings peace. Better than a thousand hollow verses is one verse that brings peace.

title: Self as Master
content: Self is the master of self. Who else can be the master? With self well-subdued, one obtains the master that is very difficult to obtain.

title: Impermanence of Life
content: As the bee collects nectar and departs without injuring the flower, or its color or scent, so let a sage dwell in his village.

title: Guarding the Mind
content: Whatever harm an enemy may do to an enemy, or a hater to a hater, an ill-directed mind inflicts on oneself a greater harm.

title: The Four Noble Truths
content: The First Truth is suffering (dukkha) - life contains suffering. The Second Truth is the origin of suffering - craving and attachment cause suffering. The Third Truth is the cessation of suffering - suffering can end. The Fourth Truth is the path to end suffering - the Noble Eightfold Path.

title: The Noble Eightfold Path
content: The path consists of: Right View, Right Intention, Right Speech, Right Action, Right Livelihood, Right Effort, Right Mindfulness, and Right Concentration. This is the way to end suffering and achieve liberation.

title: The Middle Way
content: Avoid the two extremes: indulgence in sensual pleasures and severe asceticism. The Middle Way leads to peace, wisdom, enlightenment, and nirvana.

title: Teaching on Impermanence
content: All conditioned things are impermanent. Strive with diligence! These were the Buddha's last words. Everything that arises must pass away. Understanding this brings freedom from attachment.

title: Loving-Kindness (Metta)
content: Hatred never ceases by hatred, but by love alone is healed. This is an ancient and eternal law. May all beings be happy and free from suffering. May they live with ease and in peace.
